question: Which of the following countries has recently joined the Australia Group export control regime?
explanation: India has become the 43rd member of the Australia Group export control regime on January 19, 2018. The inclusion is expected to raise India\'s stature in the field of non-proliferation and help in acquiring critical technologies. With this, India has managed entry into Missile Technology Control Regime (MTCR), the Wassenaar Arrangement and Australia Group despite not being a signatory to the Non-Proliferation Treaty (NPT).The Australia Group is an informal forum which seeks to ensure that exports do not contribute to the development of chemical or biological weapons.
